Posts.Content: This is what the sheet I recv'd from the Mayo (Rochester, MN) after surgery says. The following exercise may help you regain bladder control if you are leaking urine. Urinary leakage is often due to weak muscles. This sometimes occurs following prostate surgery. Exercise can improve muscle condition and tone, allowing you greater control over you bladder. You will exercise two groups of muscles: 1. The muscles that stop a bowel movement - This is the group of muscles you tighten when you suddenly want to stop a bowel movement or hold back gas in the rectum. 2. The muscles at the base of the penis - This is the group of muscles you use to expel the final drops of urine at the end of urination or to ejaculate semen. Perform the exercise according to the following directions: 1. Tighten the muscles you use to stop a bowel movement. 2. Then, while tightening these muscles, tighten muscles at the base of the penis (you may feel your penis pull in slightly toward your body). 3. Hold both sets of muscles as tight as possible for a count of "10". 4 Relax muscles and rest for one minute. 5 Repeat exercise six times. General Information - Perform this exercise before going to bed. This allows your muscles to rest while you sleep. - Perform this exercise once each day. If you overexercise, your muscles may become tired, and you may experience more leakage. - It is recommended that you do this exercise while sitting on a toilet seat. - Holding these muscles tight while rising from a sitting position or while lifting can help prevent urinary leakage. One you achieve urinary control, continue to perform this exercise to keep you muscles in good condition.
Posts.Title: Physical Therapy regimen with Kegels

Posts.Title: Physical Therapy regimen with Kegels

Posts.Content: My instructions from the Mayo say 6 times for the same reasons. Which Mayo were you at? I think everyone responds to exercise differently. If I remember correctly Dr. Walch book says to only do them while you are urinating. Same reason. To avoid fatigue. I am 21 days out of the cath and am no where near continent.

Posts.Content: Everyone is different. I waited 6 weeks before I resumed any strength training. I went the slowest with the ab work and I still suffered a bit.
Posts.Title: Exercising after da vinci surgery

Posts.Content: I just had my one yr. anniversary Feb. 17th. I use cialis and have had some success with it. I am going to try the injections later this month. I also use a pump pretty much on a daily basis to keep the blood flowing. I have never seen a post here about using the pump and bands to have sex. I use this regularly and my partner and I have a great relationship doing so. There is some loss of spontaneity but, the trade off is more staying power.
Posts.Title: Post-surgery ED therapy

Posts.Content: Surgery Feb 17, 2012. Results on 12/27 indicated "undetectable". Yay!
Posts.Title: undetectable
